summary: This document is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated June 30, 2020, containing a draft victim notification letter intended for non-statutory victims in the Epstein case. It appears to be part of the victim notification process related to the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, who is drafting a victim notification letter for non-statutory victims.

events.title: Draft Victim Notification Letter Prepared
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney drafts a victim notification letter for non-statutory victims, likely in relation to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated June 30, 2020, concerning victim notification in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
It includes a draft victim notification letter specifically intended for 'non-statutory victims'.
The correspondence originates from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York.
The document indicates an ongoing legal process to notify and communicate with victims as part of the prosecution.
